meanings.definition: To make or become more intense or stronger.
meanings.sent1: The storm intensifies as the wind picks up speed.
meanings.sent2: Her excitement intensifies as she gets closer to her birthday.
meanings.sent3: The suspense in the movie intensifies as the hero faces the villain.
meanings.sent4: The rivalry between the two teams intensifies as they compete for the championship.
meanings.sent5: The heat intensifies as the sun reaches its peak in the sky.

meanings.definition: To increase in degree or strength.
meanings.sent1: The pain intensifies with each step he takes.
meanings.sent2: The colors of the sunset intensifies as the evening progresses.
meanings.sent3: The laughter in the room intensifies as the comedian tells a joke.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the flowers intensifies as you get closer to the garden.
meanings.sent5: The music intensifies as the orchestra reaches the climax of the symphony.

meanings.sent1: The spices intensifies the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent2: The spotlight intensifies the focus on the lead singer.
meanings.sent3: The drama intensifies as the characters confront each other.
meanings.sent4: The contrast intensifies the beauty of the painting.
meanings.sent5: The urgency intensifies as the deadline approaches.
